alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mercer, north central Burlington and southeastern Bucks Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ewing, or near Trenton, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Ewing, Princeton, Florence, Bristol, Bordentown, Pennington, Yardley, Tullytown, Crosswicks, White Horse, Florence-Roebling, Mercerville-Hamilton Square, Levittown, Lawrenceville, Woodside, Morrisville, Fieldsboro, Yardville-Groveville and Fairless Hills. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 8. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 357 and 359. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 6. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 56 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
